Title: Software Engineer, .NET tooling, runtimes and ecosystem
Company Name: Canonical
Description: We are building a new team to focus on the .NET ecosystem on Ubuntu. They will deliver the best possible .NET runtimes and supporting tooling in Ubuntu, and enable Ubuntu users access to the wider .NET ecosystem. Our goal is to enable mission-critical .NET applications to be deployed and operated safely, securely and efficiently on large-scale Ubuntu estates. We are also keen to ensure that the cutting edge of Jav.NET innovation is available to Ubuntu users, to lay the foundation for future inventions and open source communities.   This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux systems and software architectures and Microsoft .NET technology. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company and make Ubuntu the best operating system to develop and run your .NET applications in the cloud, in datacenters, in containers, directly on the operating system, and anywhere .NET and Ubuntu can run.   The .NET ecosystem has for a long time had a place in the Linux world thanks to projects like Mono. With the advent of .NET Core, and now .NET 5 and 6, the .NET ecosystem as a whole has embraced Linux, with an emphasis on fast, scalable and reliable containerised applications. We intend for Ubuntu to excel as an operating system for developing and running .NET applications on Linux in a secure, reliable, performant and future-proof fashion. We build on the technical excellence of Debian and bring additional focus and shape to the solutions we offer. Applicants will be passionate about the future of .NET, of Ubuntu, mindful of the dynamics of the open-source ecosystem, and equally aware of the needs of large but innovative organisations.   As part of the Ubuntu Foundations team, you will work on the architecture, design and development of core components of the Ubuntu Distribution related to the .NET Framework for Linux, and associated development and operations tooling. You will be discussing designs with other team members and product managers, mentoring other engineers and participating in technical reviews. You will also work with other teams to ensure architectural decisions and improve the overall performance and experience of Ubuntu. As a member of the Ubuntu Foundations team, your work will have an impact on every aspect of the Ubuntu ecosystem from Desktop, Server, Ubuntu Core and cloud images. And you will work closely with many other teams as well as outsider partners to ensure .NET in Ubuntu containers, servers, clouds is the best .NET there is.   We believe that developers working with .NET all around the world should have a Linux operating system that makes their job easy and pleasant. Come join us and let's make this happen!    What You'll Do    Collaborate proactively with a distributed team Work with highly technical and invested product managers to define and shape the roadmap of .NET and tooling in Ubuntu Select, integrate and package best-of-breed tooling with Ubuntu to improve developer and operator experience for .NET Write high quality code to create new features Debug issues and produce high quality code to fix them Review code produced by other engineers Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks a year for internal and external events     Who You Are    You love technology and working with brilliant people You are passionate, curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable You are a long-time Linux user You have experience or are interested in learning how to package software for Debian and Ubuntu You have professional .NET experience, ideally in the world of cloud-native software, including direct experience with .NET applications building through the CLI and through automated pipelines, and have some knowledge of .NET internals You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated    What Canonical Offers:   Learning and development Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Annual leave Priority Pass for travel    What is Canonical?  Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.   We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products.  Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration  .

Description: 工作职责: 1) 负责基于嵌入式系统的智能驾驶算法和软件功能设计、应用开发、维护等； 2) 根据智能驾驶系统应用需求，设计相关AI处理算法和后处理算法，完成应用算法的代码编写调试和性能优化与迭代、性能稳定性、功耗等； 3) 与硬件，底层驱动和测试团队配合，实现应用算法的嵌入式集成、移植与测试优化； 4) 撰写相关应用处理算法开发文档、论文、专利等。 任职条件: 1) 硕士及以上学历，有嵌入式算法开发经验的优秀本科生条件可适当放宽； 2) 计算机、模式识别、机器视觉或电子信息相关专业，熟悉图像处理、模式识别、计算机视觉等相关算法。熟练掌握图像处理算法，有特征识别，HOG，SVM等设计经验为佳 3）熟悉Caffe，TensorFlow等工具，熟悉深度学习架构，有深度学习相关设计和训练经验为佳； 4) 熟悉嵌入式软件开发，有丰富的Linux或其它嵌入式环境下的软件开发经验，有良好的编码风格和习惯，精通C/C++，Python，有OpenCV，Matlab等图像或信号处理相关经验为佳； 4) 有良好的沟通和学习能力，有英文读写能力，对新技术充满热情； 5) 有汽车行业相关工作经验或背景者优先。 公司简介： 上海保隆汽车科技股份有限公司成立于1997年，2017年在上交所A股上市（股票代码：603197.SH），总部位于上海市松江区。保隆科技面向全球化经营，全球员工4500人，年营收超过33亿，立足智能化和轻量化战略方向，是汽车零部件多个细分领域龙头和全国汽车零部件百强企业。 保隆科技秉持“掌握领先技术、提升汽车部件”的企业使命，保隆员工践行“负责、上进、分享”的果园文化。欢迎有爱、有热情、有担当的您加入，共创“让更多人受益于汽车科技的发展”企业愿景。 福利待遇： 1、薪资待遇：上12个月的班，发13个月的薪资，再加上年终奖，综合14-16薪(#^.^#)。 2、试用期：试用期3个月，薪资全额，不打折。 3、五险一金：入职即缴纳（15日前），全额缴。 4、节日福利：我们比较直接，发购物卡，想买啥自己买O(∩_∩)O。 5、各类补贴：交通补贴、工龄补贴、卫生补贴，独立在工资之外的哦。 6、年度调薪：年度两次调薪机会！（年末大范围普调、年中业绩优秀者调整） 7、股票期权：如果你愿意越来越优秀，公司愿意为你的优秀买单！ 8、休息休假：双休、国家法定假、带薪年假、奖励性带薪年假、弹性工作制，工作生活平衡不是梦。 9、其他假期：如果你是女生，女神节，休！如果你是学龄儿童（3-12岁）的父母，六一儿童节，休！ 10、工作午餐：公司免费提供工作午餐，合理膳食，营养均衡。 11、免费停车：你停车，我缴费。公司为开车上班的同事提供免费停车福利。 12、健康体检：公司每年组织健康体检一次，虽然年轻，咱也得关注健康。 13、文化活动：各类文体协会，用兴趣滋养自己，让我们的生活更多彩！ 14、学习成长：专业学习培训肯定少不了，如果想读书，去考研究生，符合标准，学费公司按比例报销！ 15、定期团建：多姿多彩，形式丰富的团建活动，500元/人/年。 16、年度旅游：这里有你要的诗和远方，经费公司提供，1000元/人/年。 17、关于沟通：了解信息、融入、遇到问题、有啥想法，找HR，我们是娘家人。从日常，到试用期面谈，再到组织交流会，提供给你畅通无阻的沟通渠道！

Title: 数据科学家
Company Name: Michael Page
Description: 上市外企游戏公司|新型赛道独角兽     About Our Client  美资上市游戏公司，创新业务BU。   Job Description  1、负责用户数字化相关项目建设、整体方案设计（架构、标准、质量与风险等方面）； 2、负责用户数字化相关项目的实施工作，包括数据采集、梳理、结构化数据资产，主题数据设计、模型构建、样本数据标注、构造等环节； 3、协调公司内外部资源，按期推进消费者数字化项目进展。制定维护方案并执行，确保数据及时准确的进入相关系统，保障业务顺利运作； 4、探索数据在业务中的应用，探索数据产品化的机会，让数据在业务中发挥更大的价值； 5、深入了解会员业务、挖掘业务问题痛点，针对业务问题，独立设计数据模型，与产品、运营、研发等配合，推动数据模型落地执行，有效提升业务增长、改善用户体验。   The Successful Applicant  1、本科及以上，计算机、软件、统计、信息工程、大数据、数学等专业优先；具有5年以上行业工作经验，3年以上同等岗位工作经验； 2、具备批量处理系统数据的经验，尤其对数据标准化具备深刻认知； 3、具备数据治理、数据标准、数据建模、主数据、数据质量等管理能力；   What's On Offer  高于市场水平的薪资＋硅谷工作风格。   Contact: Dora Ren  Quote job ref: JN-032022-5380588

Title: Software Engineer-One Strata-FreeWheel
Company Name: Comcast
Description: Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.    Job Summary    Responsible for planning and designing new software and web applications. Analyzes, tests and assists with the integration of new applications. Documents all development activity. Assists with training non-technical personnel. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience.    Job Description    Core Responsibilities   Collaborates with project stakeholders to identify product and technical requirements. Conducts analysis to determine integration needs. Designs new software and web applications, supports applications under development and customizes current applications. Assists with the software update process for existing applications and roll-outs of software releases. Participates in training representatives and operations staff on internally developed software applications. Researches, writes and edits documentation and technical requirements, including software designs, evaluation plans, test results, technical manuals and formal recommendations and reports. Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products. Reviews literature, patents and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects. Provides technical leadership throughout the design process and guidance with regards to practices, procedures and techniques. Serves as a guide and mentor for junior-level Software Development Engineers. Works with Quality Assurance team to determine if applications fit specification and technical requirements. Displays in-depth knowledge of engineering methodologies, concepts, skills and their application in the area of specified engineering specialty. Displays in-depth knowledge of and ability to apply, process design and redesign skills. Presents and defends architectural, design and technical choices to internal audiences. Displays knowledge of and ability to apply, project management skills. Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance. Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary. Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.    Employees At All Levels Are Expected To    Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job. Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services. Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences. Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas. Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers. Drive results and growth. Respect and promote inclusion & diversity. Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.    Disclaimer    This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications.   Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer.  Education  Bachelor's Degree   While possessing the stated degree is preferred, Comcast also may consider applicants who hold some combination of coursework and experience, or who have extensive related professional experience.    Relevant Work Experience    5-7 Years   Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Comcast provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a Commission under the terms of an applicable plan, while most non-sales positions are eligible for a Bonus. Additionally, Comcast provides best-in-class Benefits. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most, and should help you care for those who matter most. That’s why we provide an array of options, expert guidance and always-on tools, that are personalized to meet the needs of your reality – to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life. Please visit the compensation and benefits summary on our careers site for more details.

Title: Data Scientist数据科学家
Company Name: Bayer
Description: At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.  Data Scientist数据科学家   Your Tasks And Responsibilities    Working with software and hardware product team to identify use case and further translate into data insights Performing statistical analysis, computer programming, predictive/computer vision modeling, and experimental design to meet product/venture objectives Working reproducibly by documenting, organizing, and curating data and code Analyzing and assessing the quality of data and provide QA/QC solutions Collaborating with data engineers to streamline data source, data cleansing/visualization/analysis, relational data base, and ELT process Acting as a data champion/evangelist within the organization to promote data science/AI based business innovation, operational enhancement, and strategic decision making Managing external data science partners/vendors, building cross-functional relationships to collaboratively partner with internal business team, and effectively networking within global data science community 与数据工程师合作，探索和分析世界上最独特、最有趣的数据集，其中包括与气候、环境、水果、蔬菜、供应链和消费者相关的结构化和非结构化数据 与软件和硬件产品团队密切合作，确定用例并进一步获得启发以及构建 ML/AI 解决方案 运用统计分析、计算机编程、数据科学、数据可视化和实验设计等技术方式，以满足产品 / 企业目标 分析和评估数据质量并提供 QA/QC 解决方案 作为组织内的数据拥护者 / 传道者，促进基于数据科学 / 人工智能的业务创新、增强运营和战略决策 管理外部数据科学合作伙伴 / 供应商，建立跨职能关系以与内部业务团队合作，并在全球数据科学社区内有效建立关系网    Who You Are    Advanced degree in Computer Science, Math/Statistics, Biosystem, or other related fields 5+ years of experience in researching, developing and/or implementing machine learning solutions Proficiency in data science tools and technology, such as Python, R, MySQL, and cloud-based techniques Strong understanding and skills in advanced analytics and data science models and methodology, such as statistical analysis, algorithm development, artificial intelligence, machine learning, text mining, natural language processing, and optimization Familiar with data models built on both structured and unstructured data (e.g., images) Excellent skills in communication, presentation, and stakeholder collaboration Experience with computer vision modeling is a plus 计算机科学、数学 / 统计学、生物系统或其他相关领域的高级学位 5 年以上研究、开发和 / 或实施机器学习解决方案的经验 精通数据科学工具和技术，例如 Python 、 R 、 MySQL 和基于云的技术 对高级数据分析和数据科学模型和方法有深刻的理解和扎实的技能，包括统计分析、算法开发、人工智能、机器学习、文本挖掘、自然语言处理和优化 熟悉基于结构化和非结构化数据（例如图像）的数据模型 善于沟通、展示，以及与需求方交谈 有计算机视觉建模经验者优先   YOUR APPLICATION  If your background and personal experience fit this profile, please send us your complete application at www.career.bayer.cn If you have any recommendations, please kindly send mail to cnreferral@bayer.com   L ocation:  China : ShangHai : ShangHai   Division:  Crop Science   Reference Code:  513801

Description: 世界500强高科技企业|智慧城市赛道     About Our Client  智慧城市赛道   Job Description  负责产品线的关键技术方案的设计和落地，负责网络数字化AI架构/实现/工程方法/支撑工具的持续优化和演进。   1、通过行业洞察，引入和应用业界先进的AI技术和实践，诊断和解决关键软件问题，提升软件设计/开发/验证效率；围绕产品的目标架构，确保软件实现匹配目标架构，并促进目标架构的演进；   2、负责产品关键软件技术栈的选择和管理，设计网络数字化AI架构，确保软件环境高效率的支撑产品交付，包括：数据库、操作系统、中间件、三方软件、开源软件等；   3、负责网络数字化中多模态学习的关键技术设计与开发，解决业务/性能/可靠性/可扩展性的问题，交付有竞争力的特性；   4、组织贡献：软件开发人员赋能，AI算法及AI高性能高可用架构设计的指导和培训等；   The Successful Applicant   计算机/软件/通信/自动化等相关专业，博士学历为佳，3年以上多模态学习算法研究及落地工作经验； 完美的C/C++/Java/Python编程能力，精通云化服务开发，熟悉云化服务的优先； 具有多模态相关项目和工作经验优先； 具备人工智能多模态学习算法经验优先； 熟悉机器学习特别是深度学习以及常见人工智能算法的原理与实践，能熟练运用聚类.分类.回归.排序等模型解决有挑战性的问题优先； 对多模态学习等有深入的项目应用经验的优先； 了解深度学习在多模态学习方向的相关算法和框架，有Tenorflow,Pytorch项目实战经验的优先； 具有良好的数学基础，良好的英语阅读能力，会第二外语能与国外专家无障碍交流特别优先； 有团队意识，有研发团队管理经验，与其他部门沟通合作良好优先；    What's On Offer  长期激励，从0到1开展的项目   Contact: Monica Liu  Quote job ref: JN-082021-2989799

Title: Software Engineer, .NET tooling, runtimes and ecosystem
Company Name: Canonical
Description: We are building a new team to focus on the .NET ecosystem on Ubuntu. They will deliver the best possible .NET runtimes and supporting tooling in Ubuntu, and enable Ubuntu users access to the wider .NET ecosystem. Our goal is to enable mission-critical .NET applications to be deployed and operated safely, securely and efficiently on large-scale Ubuntu estates. We are also keen to ensure that the cutting edge of Jav.NET innovation is available to Ubuntu users, to lay the foundation for future inventions and open source communities.   This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux systems and software architectures and Microsoft .NET technology. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company and make Ubuntu the best operating system to develop and run your .NET applications in the cloud, in datacenters, in containers, directly on the operating system, and anywhere .NET and Ubuntu can run.   The .NET ecosystem has for a long time had a place in the Linux world thanks to projects like Mono. With the advent of .NET Core, and now .NET 5 and 6, the .NET ecosystem as a whole has embraced Linux, with an emphasis on fast, scalable and reliable containerised applications. We intend for Ubuntu to excel as an operating system for developing and running .NET applications on Linux in a secure, reliable, performant and future-proof fashion. We build on the technical excellence of Debian and bring additional focus and shape to the solutions we offer. Applicants will be passionate about the future of .NET, of Ubuntu, mindful of the dynamics of the open-source ecosystem, and equally aware of the needs of large but innovative organisations.   As part of the Ubuntu Foundations team, you will work on the architecture, design and development of core components of the Ubuntu Distribution related to the .NET Framework for Linux, and associated development and operations tooling. You will be discussing designs with other team members and product managers, mentoring other engineers and participating in technical reviews. You will also work with other teams to ensure architectural decisions and improve the overall performance and experience of Ubuntu. As a member of the Ubuntu Foundations team, your work will have an impact on every aspect of the Ubuntu ecosystem from Desktop, Server, Ubuntu Core and cloud images. And you will work closely with many other teams as well as outsider partners to ensure .NET in Ubuntu containers, servers, clouds is the best .NET there is.   We believe that developers working with .NET all around the world should have a Linux operating system that makes their job easy and pleasant. Come join us and let's make this happen!    What You'll Do    Collaborate proactively with a distributed team Work with highly technical and invested product managers to define and shape the roadmap of .NET and tooling in Ubuntu Select, integrate and package best-of-breed tooling with Ubuntu to improve developer and operator experience for .NET Write high quality code to create new features Debug issues and produce high quality code to fix them Review code produced by other engineers Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks a year for internal and external events     Who You Are    You love technology and working with brilliant people You are passionate, curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable You are a long-time Linux user You have experience or are interested in learning how to package software for Debian and Ubuntu You have professional .NET experience, ideally in the world of cloud-native software, including direct experience with .NET applications building through the CLI and through automated pipelines, and have some knowledge of .NET internals You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated    What Canonical Offers:   Learning and development Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Annual leave Priority Pass for travel    What is Canonical?  Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.   We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products.  Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration  .

Title: Software Engineer - Python and K8s
Company Name: Canonical
Description: Our mission is to reinvent the way companies manage their open source information systems - on public clouds and in their own data centres. To achieve that we are building a new community around Python opscode for open source applications, running on Kubernetes. We want to move all of Canonical and Ubuntu IS onto this new, open source codebase.   We are confident that we can dramatically improve the experience of running complex business operations - and then we can help our customers embrace those new techniques and products. Traditionally, IS is an inward-facing operation. We would like to transform our IS team into an extension of the product engineering capability at Canonical. Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.   This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.   Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.   What you'll do   Work in Python to design and deliver open source software operations code Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code Follow agile software development practices Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with company values Work from home with global travel once or twice a year for up to 2 weeks for events    Who you are   You love technology and working with brilliant people You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes You are an excellent Python programmer and enjoy challenging projects You understand the importance of reliable software and strive to design and code to that expectation You are organized and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software     About Canonical    Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.   We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.  #Stack

Description: Net Developer Large multinational corporation positions, working on a global project. |leading technology environment and good work culture.     About Our Client  Our client is a global FMCG company focusing on providing exquisite personal care and cosmetics product to share the bestof beauty with everyone, everywhere. Our company has been a pure player in the beauty sector worldwide for decades.   Job Description  工作任务内容包括：   使用开发语言完成程序设计、开发、测试、部署以及维护相关工作； 协助业务部门梳理业务需求，提供项目规划方案、架构设计方案; 使用工具软件完成功能的开发、测试、部署以及维护相关工作； 相关文档的编写，包括设计文档、开发文档、测试文档、使用文档、系统架构和数据库设计文档； 指导用户使用相关功能，包括用户培训等； 分析现存系统中的性能瓶颈，提出并实施合理解决方案，提升现有系统性能 与开发工作相关的其它技术工作，例如数据整理等； 分配的其它与相关岗位技术能力要求相关的工作任务，例如内部分享以及针对甲方IT员工的知识分享活动；    The Successful Applicant  本科及以上学历，3年以上.NET及C#开发经验，精通ES及SQL server;   NET基础扎实，精通Net，有丰富的MVC 及前后端分离项目开发的经验；    精通SQL应用开发，熟练编写存储过程；   熟悉前端技术js、Ant_Design 、HTML、CSS、JavaScript等；   深度理解面向对象设计的原则和思想，掌握常见数据结构和算法；   理解分布式系统及原理、熟悉主流的缓存、消息、搜索等中间件；   学习能力强、思维敏捷、喜欢钻研，工作认真、有责任心，擅长团队合作精神；   加分：熟悉java或python，了解大数据spark/Hadoop/Hive。   What's On Offer  Leading MNC   Reasonable working hours and excellent working environment   Competitive salary + Full overtime pay   Leading technology and culture of continuous learning   Contact: Axe Ma  Quote job ref: JN-022022-5265508

Title: Software Engineer, .NET tooling, runtimes and ecosystem
Company Name: Canonical
Description: We are building a new team to focus on the .NET ecosystem on Ubuntu. They will deliver the best possible .NET runtimes and supporting tooling in Ubuntu, and enable Ubuntu users access to the wider .NET ecosystem. Our goal is to enable mission-critical .NET applications to be deployed and operated safely, securely and efficiently on large-scale Ubuntu estates. We are also keen to ensure that the cutting edge of Jav.NET innovation is available to Ubuntu users, to lay the foundation for future inventions and open source communities.   This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux systems and software architectures and Microsoft .NET technology. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company and make Ubuntu the best operating system to develop and run your .NET applications in the cloud, in datacenters, in containers, directly on the operating system, and anywhere .NET and Ubuntu can run.   The .NET ecosystem has for a long time had a place in the Linux world thanks to projects like Mono. With the advent of .NET Core, and now .NET 5 and 6, the .NET ecosystem as a whole has embraced Linux, with an emphasis on fast, scalable and reliable containerised applications. We intend for Ubuntu to excel as an operating system for developing and running .NET applications on Linux in a secure, reliable, performant and future-proof fashion. We build on the technical excellence of Debian and bring additional focus and shape to the solutions we offer. Applicants will be passionate about the future of .NET, of Ubuntu, mindful of the dynamics of the open-source ecosystem, and equally aware of the needs of large but innovative organisations.   As part of the Ubuntu Foundations team, you will work on the architecture, design and development of core components of the Ubuntu Distribution related to the .NET Framework for Linux, and associated development and operations tooling. You will be discussing designs with other team members and product managers, mentoring other engineers and participating in technical reviews. You will also work with other teams to ensure architectural decisions and improve the overall performance and experience of Ubuntu. As a member of the Ubuntu Foundations team, your work will have an impact on every aspect of the Ubuntu ecosystem from Desktop, Server, Ubuntu Core and cloud images. And you will work closely with many other teams as well as outsider partners to ensure .NET in Ubuntu containers, servers, clouds is the best .NET there is.   We believe that developers working with .NET all around the world should have a Linux operating system that makes their job easy and pleasant. Come join us and let's make this happen!    What You'll Do    Collaborate proactively with a distributed team Work with highly technical and invested product managers to define and shape the roadmap of .NET and tooling in Ubuntu Select, integrate and package best-of-breed tooling with Ubuntu to improve developer and operator experience for .NET Write high quality code to create new features Debug issues and produce high quality code to fix them Review code produced by other engineers Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks a year for internal and external events     Who You Are    You love technology and working with brilliant people You are passionate, curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable You are a long-time Linux user You have experience or are interested in learning how to package software for Debian and Ubuntu You have professional .NET experience, ideally in the world of cloud-native software, including direct experience with .NET applications building through the CLI and through automated pipelines, and have some knowledge of .NET internals You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated    What Canonical Offers:   Learning and development Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Annual leave Priority Pass for travel    What is Canonical?  Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.   We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products.  Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration  .

Title: Software Engineer - Python and K8s
Company Name: Canonical
Description: Our mission is to reinvent the way companies manage their open source information systems - on public clouds and in their own data centres. To achieve that we are building a new community around Python opscode for open source applications, running on Kubernetes. We want to move all of Canonical and Ubuntu IS onto this new, open source codebase.   We are confident that we can dramatically improve the experience of running complex business operations - and then we can help our customers embrace those new techniques and products. Traditionally, IS is an inward-facing operation. We would like to transform our IS team into an extension of the product engineering capability at Canonical. Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.   This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.   Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.   What you'll do   Work in Python to design and deliver open source software operations code Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code Follow agile software development practices Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with company values Work from home with global travel once or twice a year for up to 2 weeks for events    Who you are   You love technology and working with brilliant people You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes You are an excellent Python programmer and enjoy challenging projects You understand the importance of reliable software and strive to design and code to that expectation You are organized and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software     About Canonical    Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.   We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Description: <span class="artdeco-inline-feedback__message"> This job is sourced from a job board. <button aria-label="Learn more" class="artdeco-inline-feedback__linktext" type="button">Learn more </button>

Title: Software Engineer, .NET tooling, runtimes and ecosystem
Company Name: Canonical
Description: We are building a new team to focus on the .NET ecosystem on Ubuntu. They will deliver the best possible .NET runtimes and supporting tooling in Ubuntu, and enable Ubuntu users access to the wider .NET ecosystem. Our goal is to enable mission-critical .NET applications to be deployed and operated safely, securely and efficiently on large-scale Ubuntu estates. We are also keen to ensure that the cutting edge of Jav.NET innovation is available to Ubuntu users, to lay the foundation for future inventions and open source communities.   This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux systems and software architectures and Microsoft .NET technology. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company and make Ubuntu the best operating system to develop and run your .NET applications in the cloud, in datacenters, in containers, directly on the operating system, and anywhere .NET and Ubuntu can run.   The .NET ecosystem has for a long time had a place in the Linux world thanks to projects like Mono. With the advent of .NET Core, and now .NET 5 and 6, the .NET ecosystem as a whole has embraced Linux, with an emphasis on fast, scalable and reliable containerised applications. We intend for Ubuntu to excel as an operating system for developing and running .NET applications on Linux in a secure, reliable, performant and future-proof fashion. We build on the technical excellence of Debian and bring additional focus and shape to the solutions we offer. Applicants will be passionate about the future of .NET, of Ubuntu, mindful of the dynamics of the open-source ecosystem, and equally aware of the needs of large but innovative organisations.   As part of the Ubuntu Foundations team, you will work on the architecture, design and development of core components of the Ubuntu Distribution related to the .NET Framework for Linux, and associated development and operations tooling. You will be discussing designs with other team members and product managers, mentoring other engineers and participating in technical reviews. You will also work with other teams to ensure architectural decisions and improve the overall performance and experience of Ubuntu. As a member of the Ubuntu Foundations team, your work will have an impact on every aspect of the Ubuntu ecosystem from Desktop, Server, Ubuntu Core and cloud images. And you will work closely with many other teams as well as outsider partners to ensure .NET in Ubuntu containers, servers, clouds is the best .NET there is.   We believe that developers working with .NET all around the world should have a Linux operating system that makes their job easy and pleasant. Come join us and let's make this happen!    What You'll Do    Collaborate proactively with a distributed team Work with highly technical and invested product managers to define and shape the roadmap of .NET and tooling in Ubuntu Select, integrate and package best-of-breed tooling with Ubuntu to improve developer and operator experience for .NET Write high quality code to create new features Debug issues and produce high quality code to fix them Review code produced by other engineers Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks a year for internal and external events     Who You Are    You love technology and working with brilliant people You are passionate, curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable You are a long-time Linux user You have experience or are interested in learning how to package software for Debian and Ubuntu You have professional .NET experience, ideally in the world of cloud-native software, including direct experience with .NET applications building through the CLI and through automated pipelines, and have some knowledge of .NET internals You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated    What Canonical Offers:   Learning and development Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Annual leave Priority Pass for travel    What is Canonical?  Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.   We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products.  Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration  .

Title: Software Engineer - Python and K8s
Company Name: Canonical
Description: Our mission is to reinvent the way companies manage their open source information systems - on public clouds and in their own data centres. To achieve that we are building a new community around Python opscode for open source applications, running on Kubernetes. We want to move all of Canonical and Ubuntu IS onto this new, open source codebase.   We are confident that we can dramatically improve the experience of running complex business operations - and then we can help our customers embrace those new techniques and products. Traditionally, IS is an inward-facing operation. We would like to transform our IS team into an extension of the product engineering capability at Canonical. Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.   This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.   Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.   What you'll do   Work in Python to design and deliver open source software operations code Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code Follow agile software development practices Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with company values Work from home with global travel once or twice a year for up to 2 weeks for events    Who you are   You love technology and working with brilliant people You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes You are an excellent Python programmer and enjoy challenging projects You understand the importance of reliable software and strive to design and code to that expectation You are organized and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software     About Canonical    Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.   We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.  #Stack

Title: Java Developer-Shanghai
Company Name: DataVisor
Description: 岗位描述：   搭建AI应⽤平台，提供亿级流量、⾼并发、⾼可⽤、快速部署⻛控平台。 设计系统架构，满⾜现有业务需求，增强现有项目稳定性。 紧跟目前开源社区最新技术解决⽅案，参与社区讨论与建设。    Requirements  岗位要求：   2年相关⼯作经验 熟练掌握⽬前流⾏开源框架(spring/springmvc/ibatis)，并且对其核心思想、实现原理有⼀定认知 熟悉分布式应⽤系统的相关框架及技术，如rpc框架、配置中⼼心、消息队列、缓存等 有⽐较好的⾯向对象设计和编程理念，有较好的设计功底，掌握⼀部分设计模式 在技术领域有很好的学习钻研精神 熟悉nosql、开源软件优先    Benefits  DataVisor维择科技是一家全球知名的AI风控公司，由AI科学家谢映莲博士和俞舫博士于2013年创建，在 北京、上海、深圳、硅谷等地设有分支机构，客户遍布中国、东南亚、欧洲和北美。   维择科技运用云计算、大数据、机器学习等前沿技术，致力于金融科技与监管科技创新，依托尖端的无监 督机器学习专利算法、领先的互联网化实时架构和丰富的全球反欺诈行业经验，为当下复杂的风控问题提供了端到端、一站式解决方案。无论是常规的已知欺诈，还是变化多端的未知欺诈，维择科技均可提前发现、预警及拦截，助力客户在降低欺诈损失、提升管理效率、改善运营环境的同时保障用户感知，用AI技术持续为客户创造价值。截至目前，维择科技在全球范围内累计处理超过1万亿次用户事件，检测出超过2亿的坏用户，保护了来自全球大型互联网公司和金融机构的超过45亿用户，服务客户包括中国平安、浦发银行、中信银行、宁波银行、财付通、字节跳动、快手等。   公司核心技术团队博士占比超65%，来自卡内基梅隆大学、加州大学伯克利分校、哈佛大学、清华大学等国际顶尖院校。2015年10月，DataVisor维择科技宣布获得由GSR与New Enterprise Associates领投的A轮融资；2016年5月，获得元生资本的B轮投资；2018年2月，宣布获得由红杉资本中国基金领投的四千万美元C轮；2019年获得“泛海投资”投资的数千万美金的C+轮融资。

Title: Software Engieer
Company Name: Aptiv
Description: Major Job Responsibilities   Design and develop platform software modules for multiple product line, such as Infotainment system, ASDM, Gateway, etc. Develop and execute detailed test plans and software tools. Verify and validate software on bench and in vehicle To define and to maintain the methodologies and the toolchain needed for software code's automatic or manual generation Follow software process using ASPICE/Agile Cooperate and exchange technical information with global team    Qualifications    Required Skills:   B.S. or higher degree in Electrical/Electronics or Computer Science Engineering At least 3 years working experience in Linux/QNX/RTOS embedded software developing, debugging, customizing, performance tuning MCU/CPU thorough knowledge and development experience(One of TI / Renesas / Qualcomm / Infineon / NXP / etc…) Proficient C/C++ programming skill is a must AUTOSAR(CP & AP) awareness Good knowledge of Linux, QNX, RTOS, GPIO, I2C, UART, SPI, I2S, CAN, etc. Excellent problem solving skill and analytical skill Good ability of work with global software team Good communication skills with internal teams and customers Good oral/written English Good teamwork spirit    Preferred Skills    Python language AUTOSAR development toolschain (Vector Davinci / Mentor BST / ETATS / etc). Experience in hardware solutions such as i.MX5/6, TI J6, R-CAR HX, V850, RH850, K0R, etc. Experience in ADAS product development experience Knowledge about analog/logical electronics Quick learner and a team player with passion for new technology   Privacy Notice - Active Candidates: https://www.aptiv.com/privacy-notice-active-candidates   Aptiv is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Software Engineer - Python and K8s
Company Name: Canonical
Description: Our mission is to reinvent the way companies manage their open source information systems - on public clouds and in their own data centres. To achieve that we are building a new community around Python opscode for open source applications, running on Kubernetes. We want to move all of Canonical and Ubuntu IS onto this new, open source codebase.   We are confident that we can dramatically improve the experience of running complex business operations - and then we can help our customers embrace those new techniques and products. Traditionally, IS is an inward-facing operation. We would like to transform our IS team into an extension of the product engineering capability at Canonical. Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.   This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.   Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.   What you'll do   Work in Python to design and deliver open source software operations code Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code Follow agile software development practices Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with company values Work from home with global travel once or twice a year for up to 2 weeks for events    Who you are   You love technology and working with brilliant people You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes You are an excellent Python programmer and enjoy challenging projects You understand the importance of reliable software and strive to design and code to that expectation You are organized and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software     About Canonical    Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.   We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.  #Stack

    支持客户进行电子车载SoC的系统开发。主要集中在Linux/Android和其它OS 的BSP。包括:
Linux/Android BSP和应用的开发 通过邮件或QA系统进行日常的技术支持和疑难解析

Profile

Job Offer 良好的薪资待遇、多元化的合作环境、直面前端客户的机会，balance的工作节奏 To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact **Eric Zheng** on **+86 10 5969 0480**

Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.   This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.   Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.   What you'll do   Work in Python to design and deliver open source software operations code Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code Follow agile software development practices Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with company values Work from home with global travel once or twice a year for up to 2 weeks for events    Who you are   You love technology and working with brilliant people You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes You are an excellent Python programmer and enjoy challenging projects You understand the importance of reliable software and strive to design and code to that expectation You are organized and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software     About Canonical    Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.   We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.  #Stack

Title: Software Engineer - Python and K8s
Company Name: Canonical
Description: Our mission is to reinvent the way companies manage their open source information systems - on public clouds and in their own data centres. To achieve that we are building a new community around Python opscode for open source applications, running on Kubernetes. We want to move all of Canonical and Ubuntu IS onto this new, open source codebase.   We are confident that we can dramatically improve the experience of running complex business operations - and then we can help our customers embrace those new techniques and products. Traditionally, IS is an inward-facing operation. We would like to transform our IS team into an extension of the product engineering capability at Canonical. Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.   This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.   Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.   What you'll do   Work in Python to design and deliver open source software operations code Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code Follow agile software development practices Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with company values Work from home with global travel once or twice a year for up to 2 weeks for events    Who you are   You love technology and working with brilliant people You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes You are an excellent Python programmer and enjoy challenging projects You understand the importance of reliable software and strive to design and code to that expectation You are organized and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software     About Canonical    Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.   We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.  #Stack

Title: SW Engineer
Company Name: Michael Page
Description: Our client is one of the European companies with more than 100 years history.|Large number of manufacturing facilities around the world.Focus on Automotive.     About Our Client  Our client is one of the European companies with more than 100 years history and large number of manufacturing facilities around the world. Focused on Automotive.   Job Description   take part to the products development give the technical support to other engineering group follow company Product Development Standard and sw development standard use configuration management tool to maintain quality records. analyze the customers requirements and generate sw Requirement Specification. design and create sw following company coding standard. give the technical support to the project, hardware, sw validation and other functional team : participate to the product/project team meeting. take part in the product improvement (tooling improvement, tests sequence)   The Successful Applicant  Bachelor in Electronic Engineering, Computer Science or related engineering.   3+ years experience in real-time embedded sw environment.   Ability to work effectively within a global team.   Background of embedded sw product development phases (mandatory).   Experience in C programming (mandatory).   Experience in embedded sw design, coding and testing (mandatory).   Experience in at least one kind of Microchip, can read and understand Microchip, memory and EEPROM user manual.   Experience of automotive communication protocols, like KWP200, ISO9141, CAN/J1850 and GMLAN is preferred.   Have hand on experience in using emulator, debugging, unit testing and integration testing.   Automotive Sw Development Experience Is Preferred  Have basic hardware knowledge   Capable to handle Lab equipment, Oscilloscope, logic analyzer, multi-meter waveform generator, etc.   Skills in relationship and management / leadership required: rigorous, autonomous，team spirit and self-motivated   Fluent Chinese and English   What's On Offer  World-class business interface, internal promotional as well as attractive package will be provided for this role.   Contact: Sara Zhang  Quote job ref: 4215508

Title: EOL Software and Application engineer
Company Name: Bosch China
Description: 工作职责:   Authoring End of Line (EOL) Tests and Sequences executed at the EOL System of the Car Manufacturer On-site testing/validating and deploying of EOL diagnostic hardware and software Verify the EOL test sequences in office and on site Preparing and participating in plant launches of EOL test systems Working onsite resolving issues on any aspect of a project with minimal or no assistance from other resources will be required in emergency situations Responsible for costumer training Preparing user requirement documentation and design specification documentation. Maintain good communication with customer 任职条件: Background in Electrical Engineering / Software Engineering or other relevant major 2. 2-Year experience related with Software or Automotive technology Strong interest in vehicle electrics and electronics Skillful in programming with at least one language (C/C++, java, JavaScript, etc Knowledge of Linux is a plus Knowledge of automotive diagnostic protocol such as KWP2000, UDS is a plus Knowledge of automotive communication bus such as DoIP, CAN, K-Line is a plus Knowledge of ODX/OTX is a plus Basic hardware knowledge, electrical schematics experience is a plus Job Relevant Knowledge and Experience知识及经验要求 . Familiar with car diagnostic communication protocols (KWP2000, ISO14230, ISO15765, J1939 and ISO14229, ISO 13400) knowledge is preferred Skillful in programming with at least one language(C/C++, java, JavaScript, etc.). Familiar with SQL/database theory Understand the software development process. Good presentation skills, good team spirit, a strong initiative to learn new knowledge. ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS: MINIMUM REQUIREMENT CET6 GOOD COMMUNICATION SKILLS SELF-ORGANIZED AND SELF-MANAGEMENT TEAM PLAYER ACCEPT BUSINESS TRAVEL

Title: EG - Statistical Programmer
Company Name: Pfizer
Description: Accountable and responsible for the provision of standard and non-standard datasets, tables, listings and figures based on the protocol and SAP that are required for the study reports, submissions and product defense. Serves as the point of contact and responsibility at the individual study level and may be responsible for multiple studies within or across assets. Ensures excellence in the delivery of analysis ready data sets, tables, listings and figures, in order to advance research, development, and commercialization of the Pfizer portfolio. Ensures adherence to high-quality programming standards in the production of clinical reports, and submission documentation. Delivers according to the overall protocol timeline and quality goals through matrix communication within the Study Team. Ensures programming deliverables are reproducible, defendable and inspection ready at any time.   Pfizer is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.   Medical

Title: 技术支援工程师
Company Name: Michael Page
Description: 大规模技术团队|具有竞争力的薪酬     About Our Client  我们的客户是一家发展稳健的港资奢侈品企业，拥有庞大的IT研发团队，每年投放在软件研发的资源在行业内属于高水平。今年他们致力筹备中国团队的扩张，正在寻找专业的IT技术支援工程师加入他们的团队。   Job Description  作为一线的技术支援工程师，你需要具备IT相关的技术知识，为用户提供有效的协助，并在适当的时候将问题转交技术团队。你需要有效了解来自公司用户端的各种问题，经过分析后尽量协助提供解决方案。   The Successful Applicant  你需要拥有卓越的沟通、向上管理、预期管理以及解决问题的技巧。英语读写需要能成为工作语言，会广东话的候选人优先考虑。候选人可以选择在广州或佛山工作。顾问需要拥有相关的证书，如ITIL。   What's On Offer   有竞争力的薪酬福利 良好的雇主品牌   Contact: Rhea Liu  Quote job ref: JN-122021-4562596

Title: Application Engineer - 电气
Company Name: RGF Professional Recruitment China
Description: Company Overview    The company is Tier1 OEM in automobile industry. Well known brand in vertical market.    Job Description    Key Job Elements    The Key Job Elements Include    Keep abreast of EV technical and product developments Identifies and comprehends global EV customer needs, applications, and desired features sets, and drives product requirement changes and enhancements through the established processes Lead technical EV product discussions with internal customer integration and sales teams Lead technical EV product discussions with external engineering and sales teams as required Communicates and educates OEMs about E-axle requirements Communicates and educates team about EV development at OEMs Works closely with customers to identify technical and scheduling requirements, proposes solutions, and supports validation of customer’s applications. Activities may include, but are not limited to: Use analytical tools to optimize EV powertrain configuration and provide recommendations to OEM Installation reviews Calibration development Vehicle testing such as integration, driveability, optimization, etc. Data collection and analysis Support OEM release process requirements Customer supplier development for support equipment    Qualifications Required    5-10 years’ experience with vehicle systems development Be familiar with electric vehicle system architecture, motor and inverter, and controller integration, understand commercial or automobile electronic product system design and power line system, and be able to develop system requirement specification. Be familiar with vehicle system, working principle and characteristics of motor, transmission and inverter parts and systems; understand vehicle system and common controller, load function and characteristics; Understand electric drive bench test or engine powertrain bench test, and understand various bench tests of controller product development; Ability to use and interpret analytical techniques to verify or select alternative design approaches
